On Sat, Jun 25, 2011 at 10:30, Chris Adoretti wrote:
I'm curious if this is a browser issue, but in all the demos it seems certain widgets have some strange text highlighting/ focus maintaining side effects. I apologize if the lingo is not correct/not making sense.
For an example of what I'm talking about:
http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/showcase/#tree
Try clicking on one of the dates in the tree view repeatedly. It highlights the tree text which seems like a non intuitive side effect. I'm not sure why I chose to click a lot on the date field, but you know that old saying with the programmer crashing the game by jumping on trees.
...
This also shows up on http://demo.qooxdoo.org/current/showcase/#form when you click repeatedly on any of the buttons in the top right panel. I'm sure it exists elsewhere.
For the record, I'm experiencing this on Windows 7 with Google Chrome 12.0.742.100.
For whats it worth, this _doesn't_ seem to occur when browsing with Internet Explorer 8.0.7600.16385 or Firefox 5.0 on the same Windows 7 system.

(In reply to comment #1) > For whats it worth, this _doesn't_ seem to occur when browsing with Internet > Explorer 8.0.7600.16385 or Firefox 5.0 on the same Windows 7 system.
but it does also occur on Google Chrome 12.0.742.100 on Linux.
Do you guys speak of the text selection of the scribing text in the showcase? If I double click on chrome, the text gets selected. Is that the issue?

(In reply to comment #3) > Do you guys speak of the text selection of the scribing text in the showcase? > If I double click on chrome, the text gets selected. Is that the issue?
When you double-click on an element in the tree, the large heading "Tree" in the text column above the paragraph that begins "The two tree views display some hierarchical data..." gets selected.
